hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Stress Transition via Liquidity Shock
hypothesis_content.statement: When market is in NEUTRAL regime with funding rates between -0.01% and +0.01% (neutral sentiment), a sudden 2-hour volume spike ≥300% of 20-day average that moves price ±3.5% will trigger STRESS regime within 6 hours, with continued directional move of ±7-12% over next 48 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes with compressed funding indicate balanced positioning. Extreme volume spikes represent institutional flows or forced liquidations that overwhelm current equilibrium, creating momentum that transitions market to STRESS regime as participants react to unexpected volatility.
entry_conditions: BTC perpetual funding rate between -0.01% and +0.01% for 24h
Enter in direction of initial spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: Additional 7% move in spike direction (10% total from pre-spike)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price retraces >61.8% of initial spike move

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Majority (>55%) of 300% volume spikes in neutral regimes with flat funding fail to produce STRESS regime or continued directional momentum beyond 24 hours.
